meanings.definition: Given or done as a token of honour or respect without the normal duties or functions.
meanings.sent1: The club awarded him an honourary membership for his dedication.
meanings.sent2: She received an honourary award for her volunteer work.
meanings.sent3: Being an honourary member meant he could attend events without any obligations.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an honourary badge of kindness.
meanings.sent5: The honourary title made him feel truly appreciated.

meanings.definition: Holding a position or title without the usual responsibilities or benefits.
meanings.sent1: The honourary president attended the ceremony as a figurehead.
meanings.sent2: He was given an honourary degree for his contributions to the field.
meanings.sent3: The honourary role allowed him to be part of the team without extra work.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room like an honourary echo of joy.
meanings.sent5: The honourary position gave him a sense of belonging without pressure.
